required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fat Quality on Blood Lipids and Immune Response

lead_sponsor.agency: Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences

clinical_study.source: Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate blood LDL-cholesterol and level of inflammatory markers after intake of food items with different fatty acid composition.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.description: Change in LDL-cholesterol when compared to control diet
Change in total cholesterol when compared to control diet

secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory markers in circulation and at gene expression level in PBMC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Inflammatory markers are measured at baseline and after 8 weeks intervention in circulation and at gene expression level in PBMC

secondary_outcome.measure: Markers of lipid metabolism at gene expression level in PBMC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Markers of lipid metabolism at gene expression level in PBMC is measured at baseline and after 8 weeks of intervention
Appetite hormones is measured at baseline and after 8 weeks of intervention
Gut peptides are measured at baseline and after 8 weeks of intervention

arm_group.description: Food items low in saturated fat and high in polyunsaturated fat
Food items containing saturated fat and polyunsaturated fat according to a traditional Norwegian diet

intervention.description: Food items with different fatty acid composition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- hsCRP < 10 mg/L
- total cholesterol 5-7.8 mmol/l(50-70 y)
- total cholesterol 5.0-6.9 mmol/l (30-49 y)
- total cholesterol 5.0-6.1 mmol/l (25-29 y)
- LDL-cholesterol at or above 3.5 mmol/l
- triglycerides at or lower 2.6 mmol/l
- BMI 20-31
- Stable bodyweight last 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic diseases
- fasting glucose > 6.0 mmol/l
- increased ASAT and ALAT
- medications affecting lipidmetabolism and inflammation

overall_official.affiliation: Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences
Department of Nutrition, Institute for Basic Medical Sciences, University of Oslo

facility.name: Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences
